title: Logistic growth differential equation in cafeteria

content.question: The number of students in a cafeteria is modeled by the function P that satisfies the logistic differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>2000</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>200</mn><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>P</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@456A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where t is the time in seconds and P(0) = 25. What is the greatest rate of change, in students per second, of the number of students in the cafeteria?

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
